other_tests.findings: There is a predominately hypoattenuating 3.5 cm lobulated mass adjacent to the greater curvature of the stomach. The appendix is enlarged, with maximum diameter measuring 9 mm. There is a 3 mm hyperdensity at the base of the appendix which may represent an obstructing appendicolith. Several scattered millimetric hypodensities in the liver, likely representing cysts or biliary hamartomas.
